senses.sense_definition: Something used to add taste or flavour to food, such as salt, pepper, herbs, or spices.

examples.text: The soup tastes a bit bland, so I think it needs more <w>seasoning</w>.
You can create a delicious rub for the chicken using a simple <w>seasoning</w> of salt, paprika, and garlic powder.

senses.sense_definition: The process of adding a layer of fat to cookware to make the surface non-stick.

examples.text: Proper <w>seasoning</w> is essential to keep a cast iron skillet in good condition.
The black, shiny surface of the wok is the result of years of careful <w>seasoning</w>.

senses.sense_definition: The process of drying wood in the air to reduce its moisture content.

examples.text: The <w>seasoning</w> of the timber took several months before it was ready for construction.
If the <w>seasoning</w> is not done correctly, the wood may warp or crack later.

senses.sense_definition: Anything added to increase enjoyment or interest.

examples.text: His speech was very dry and lacked the <w>seasoning</w> of humor.
A little bit of danger acted as a <w>seasoning</w> to their otherwise routine lives.
After a long night at the tavern, the sailor suffered from a severe <w>seasoning</w>.
The officers took such a <w>seasoning</w> that they could barely walk back to the ship.

senses.sense_definition: The charging of laps or wheels with diamond dust and oil in diamond-cutting.

examples.text: The apprentice learned the precise method for the <w>seasoning</w> of the cutting wheel.
Without proper <w>seasoning</w>, the lap will not polish the diamond effectively.

senses.sense_definition: The present participle and gerund of <w>season</w>.

examples.text: She is currently <w>seasoning</w> the steak with fresh ground pepper.
<w>Seasoning</w> the sauce correctly is the most important step in this recipe.
